labels.label:
This flow demonstrates how QueryMarkLogic can be used to read batches 
of documents from MarkLogic, creating a new FlowFile for each document. 
The new FlowFiles are logged for sake of example; they would typically be 
sent to another processor for whatever processing is required. 

The processor is configured to query on the "put-example" collection. This 
collection will contain documents written by the "PutMarkLogic example" 
process group. It is recommended to run the flow in that process group first 
so that this flow can query on its data.

labels.label:
This flow demonstrates how PutMarkLogicRecord can be used to write multiple 
documents to MarkLogic based on an array of JSON objects. GenerateFlowFile 
generates a FlowFile containing an array of 3 JSON objects. PutMarkLogicRecord
uses a NiFi JsonTreeReader to extract the 3 JSON objects so that 3 separate
documents are written to MarkLogic.

Before running this flow, click on the cog icon in the "Operate" panel on the left 
and enable the JsonTreeReader and JsonRecordSetWriter services.

labels.label:
This flow demonstrates how PutMarkLogic can write FlowFiles to MarkLogic as 
documents. GenerateFlowFile is used to generate batches of FlowFiles, each 
containing a simple JSON object. PutMarkLogic is then configured to write these 
to MarkLogic as new JSON documents.

The results of writing the documents are logged via NiFi's LogAttribute processor. 
The new URIs are in each FlowFile, which would allow for subsequent processors 
to perform additional processing of the URIs if desired.

Each process group below demonstrates a particular MarkLogic processor in action.

You can double-click on a process group to enter it. Each has a label to describe 
what is shown in the flow within the process group.

Before trying to run the flows in these process groups, click on the cog icon in the 
"Operate" panel on the left and configure the "Documents-8000" controller service 
by adding the password for your "admin" user. You can then enable the controller 
service so that the flows can be run.
